p: Eight studies have assessed public understanding of the health harms associated with climate change in the non-English-speaking world. Three of these studies have been conducted in Africa (two in Tanzania and one in Nigeria [ 41– 43]) and four in Asia (Bangladesh, Nepal, Tibet, and Vietnam) [ 43– 46], with one additional study in Malta [ 31]. In all cases but one (Malta), this research has focused on especially vulnerable regions and populations.
